TopicTitle: Uncompressed video, raw footage, Max Settings. "Gundam ship flight"

Articles.Content:
The video footage is 100% raw.

This is as good as it gets for video footage and it's @ 50 FPs, not the 30 most people use.

So you get silky smooth playback.

Just like you were playing the game yourself.

Ran on 2x GTX 680 in sli @ absolute maximum settings.

It's a new ship I made, I lovingly call Gundam, with it's piggybacking ship.

Both ships are fully capable of take off and landing.

Gundam reaches orbit easily with it's piggybacker ship, that can be jettisoned and flown.

This shows the transition of both ships, from inception, to orbit and separation.

Then back to the launch pad.

Kind of a day in the life of a Kerbonaut.

With download links to the ships if you want them.

Enjoy.

I know I did.

Edited August 9, 2013 by B15hop

Actually, I will post on this thread.

Did you just run FRAPS on best quality or something?

It seems like it.

Edited August 8, 2013 by sodra
Wrong Thread, but eh...why not?

Actually, I will post on this thread.

Did you just run FRAPS on best quality or something?

It seems like it.

Yep. Max quality, in the paid for version.

Also it's @ 50 FPS, not the standard 30 most people use, so it's smooth like silk on playback.

If you had moved the files to movie maker "Like most people do" then uploaded them.

You'd end up with files in the 100's of megabytes size.

I really hope someone doesn't come in here talking about how it's not max settings.

I actually edit HD video for a living and there is a huge difference between what I did here and what most people upload.

Edited August 8, 2013 by B15hop

I rather not get in an argument about Blu-ray and frame rates

I'll just ask this...

Why?

I rather not get in an argument about Blu-ray and frame rates

I'll just ask this...

Why?

For people who like to watch this kind of stuff.

For people who don't need to ask why..

I'm less impressed by the quality of the video footage than the fact you got that thing off the runway.

And what happened in the second video? It sounded like you were running the engines on Jeb's moonshine!

Very impressive. I would ask you to do more videos like this, but 60 GB along with Youtube's upload rates are kind of non-synchronous with each other.

If only .21 ran that fast in the VAB anymore for me. Or at launch. Or at any time since .20

I'm less impressed by the quality of the video footage than the fact you got that thing off the runway.

And what happened in the second video? It sounded like you were running the engines on Jeb's moonshine!

Not sure about the audio, it seems buggy in this game a bit.

lol..

I like a challenge.

Sure I could build a simple stage rocket or drop some turbines on a small ship.

I just like making crazy stuff..

Things that make you have to do everything right, or fail miserably and magnificently..lol..

Very impressive. I would ask you to do more videos like this, but 60 GB along with Youtube's upload rates are kind of non-synchronous with each other.

If only .21 ran that fast in the VAB anymore for me. Or at launch. Or at any time since .20

I'll work on sizing them down a bit. Making shorter clips.

The video is in 12 clips, in a playback list. You can selectively choose which to watch if you'd like.

Here is a before and after of a ship I am working on now. Make it into orbit as is but still working on it's stability.

I call the first phase "The Bloomin Onion", Second phase I just call "Tank".

It's whole purpose is to transport heavy fuel tanks into orbit, to be used as refueling stations.
